parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A sudden tire blowout can cause loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
Installing tires in the wrong direction can compromise their performance, particularly in wet conditions, leading to loss of traction, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities.
The over-sensitivity of the ABS system can cause lengthened stopping distances, a feeling of lack of control, and potentially lead to accidents, especially when driving on uneven roads or downhill.
symptoms: causing the brake pedal to drop
and the brakes to pump excessively
even on small bumps or road imperfections.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The surface imperfections on the brake rotors can cause incomplete brake shoe contact, leading to uneven brake wear, grinding noises, and potentially unsafe braking performance.
symptoms: Brake shoes wear out prematurely (before 5000 miles)
grinding noises are heard when braking
and concentric grooves appear on the rotor surface.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The fuel vapor leak into the cabin can cause health risks to occupants, especially in enclosed spaces, and may lead to fires or explosions in extreme cases.
symptoms: Strong gas or fuel odor inside the vehicle cabin
especially when starting the engine in cold temperatures
the smell may dissipate after a short period of time.
